business.headline: Fortunes soar: India's richest cross $1 trillion mark amid market rallyForbes' analysis shows that India's 100 richest individuals now have a total net worth of $1.1 trillion, more than doubling their wealth since 2019.

Nariman Point's revival: Office rents expected to nearly double by 2030The report, titled 'South Mumbai – A Renaissance', attributes this expected surge to ongoing infrastructure improvements and rising demand for premium office space in the area.

Tata group stocks surge 3% as Noel Tata takes charge at Tata TrustsNoel Tata's appointment came after the death of Ratan Tata, former chairman of Tata Sons, on October 9 at the age of 86.

Appointed Chairman of Tata Trusts, Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata Noel Tata has been appointed as the new Chairman of Tata Trusts, effective October 11, following the death of his half-brother Ratan Tata on October 9 at the age of 86.

Who is Noel Tata, new Tata Trusts Chairman and half-brother of Ratan TataNoel Tata has made significant contributions to the Tata Group's growth and success. His strategic vision, coupled with his deep understanding of the group's businesses, has enabled him to play a key role in driving innovation and expanding the group's global reach.

Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata, unanimously appointed Chairman of Tata TrustsNoel Tata has been a part of the Tata Group for over 40 years. The appointment was made during a meeting held in Mumbai and was unanimously agreed upon by the board of Tata Trusts.

Mehli Mistry, Noel Tata lead race to become Tata Trusts chairman: ReportNoel Tata is already a trustee in the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust, which together hold a 66% stake in Tata Sons, the holding company of the Tata Group.

Rupee falls to all-time low against dollar amid oil price surgeThe rupee weakened to 83.99 per dollar, slightly surpassing its previous all-time low of 83.9850 recorded on September 12, and down from the 83.9675 level seen in the prior trading session.

Murthy lauded Ratan Tata as a 'compassionate human being who transcended financial status and official power.'

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Express train collides with goods train near Chennai, fire breaks out in 2 coachesSix coaches of the Mysuru-Darbhanga Bhagmati express derailed and fire erupted in two coaches after the express train rammed into the rear of a goods train stationed on a loop line at the Kavaraipettai railway station on Friday.

Air India Express flight makes emergency landing in Trichy after mid-air snagThe flight, with 140 passengers on board, took off from Trichy airport for Sharjah at 5.43 pm but soon developed a hydraulic failure.

Justin Trudeau says met PM Modi in Laos: Real issues we need to solveAccording to Trudeau, he spoke to PM Modi about the "work that we need to do", alluding to the strained ties between the two nations after he alleged New Delhi's involvement in the killing of Khalistani terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar last year.

Back home from war zone in Lebanon, India Today's Ashraf Wani shares his experienceAfter covering the Israel-Hezbollah war in Lebanon for 15 days, India Today's Ashraf Wani is back home and shares first-hand experience of covering the war at the front.

The film is a two-and-a-half-hour ride full of loud dialogues, over-the-top action, bad BGM and a mess of a story.

Karnataka government withdraws 2022 Hubballi riot cases against AIMIM leadersThe Congress-led Karnataka government has decided to withdraw criminal cases against AIMIM leaders who were accused of leading a mob that attacked the police and threatened to break into the police station in Hubballi in 2022.
2 Agniveers killed as artillery shell burst during firing exercise in MaharashtraThe Agniveers had come from Hyderabad for training at Artillery School in Deolali, Nashik in Maharashtra.

CCTV captures theft of Kali crown gifted by PM Modi to Bangladesh templeA crown gifted by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the Jeshoreshwari Kali Temple in Satkhira in Bangladesh, has been stolen. The silver, gold-plated crown, presented during Modi's visit in 2021, was stolen on Thursday afternoon after the temple priest left following worship. CCTV footage captured a man stealing the crown.

Meanwhile, India has expressed its concern over the incident and urged the Bangladesh government to recover the stolen crown and bring the culprits to justice. Police said they are analysing the CCTV footage to identify the suspect.

Bipasha Basu's daughter at puja pandal is the cutest thing on internet todayBipasha Basu joined the Durga Puja celebrations with her husband, Karan Singh Grover, and their daughter, Devi, at the North Bombay Sarbojonin Durga Puja. Bipasha and Karan's daughter was the centre of attention, dressed in a red lehenga, mesmerising everyone with her cute antics.

The actor met Sushmita Sen's daughters, Renee and Alisah, at the pandal. While speaking to them, the actor was seen encouraging them to learn Bengali and also sent her regards for Sushmita.

Voluntarily retiring hurt to be deemed out: BCCI revamps domestic cricket rulesThe Board of Control for Cricket in India has opted to make major changes in domestic cricket. One of the main changes states that batters who retire voluntarily will be deemed out unless they are injured.

Indian Olympic body highlights incompetency of treasurer leading to financial lossThe Indian Olympic Association brought to light the incompetency of its treasurer in filing the necessary annual financial reports despite repeated reminders from the International Olympic Committee (IOC).

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.
